        • pycheron.util.masks

    pycheron.util.masks¶

    consecutive(data, stepsize=1)[source]¶

    Cluster consecutive elements where indices differ by stepsize. Utility to group masks/QC issue start/stop times

    Parameters:
    • data (numpy.ndarray) – array of indices to cluster consecutive elements for trace
    • stepsize (int) – stepsize to use for clustering consecutive elements where indices differ.
    Returns:

    Returns list of arrays of consecutive indices
    Return type:

    list
    samples2time(mask_index, fs, start)[source]¶

    This function takes in index locations and converts the locations into time

    Parameters:
    • mask_index (numpy.array) – array containing the index locations of where there is a QC issue
    • fs (float) – Sampling frequency
    • start (obspy.core.utcdatetime.UTCDateTime) – Start time of tr
    Returns:

    List of dictionaries with the following keys and types:

    • start_time (str) - Start time of mask
    • end_time (str) - End time of mask
    Return type:

    list
